text: Luigi Snozzi (29 July 1932 – 29 December 2020) was a Swiss architect. He was born in Mendrisio, Ticino. From 1962 to 1971, Snozzi worked with architect Livio Vacchini. From 1982 to 1984, he was a Visiting Professor and in 1985 he was appointed Professor of Architecture at École Polytechnique Fédérale de Lausanne. Snozzi was a professor of the University of Sassari, at the Faculty of Architecture of Alghero, Sardinia. Snozzi died in Minusio, Switzerland on 29 December 2020 from COVID-19, at the age of 88.Addio a Luigi Snozzi ==References== Category:1932 births Category:2020 deaths Category:Swiss businesspeople Category:Swiss academics Category:Deaths from the COVID-19 pandemic in Switzerland Category:Swiss architects Category:Mendrisio District Category:People from Ticino Category:21st-century architects Category:20th- century architects
